questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of linear regression?

answers.a: To group data points into clusters
answers.b: To model the linear relationship between a predictor and a response variable

explanations.a: Clustering is an unsupervised learning method, not regression.
explanations.b: Correct! Linear regression estimates how X affects Y using a linear relationship.
explanations.c: Classification predicts categories, not continuous values.
explanations.d: Noise removal is part of preprocessing, not regression.

questions.question: What does a high Mean Squared Error (MSE) tell us about a regression model?

answers.a: The model’s predictions are far from actual values
answers.b: The regression line fits the data well

explanations.a: Correct! A high MSE means large differences between predicted and real values.
explanations.b: A good fit would have low MSE.
explanations.c: High MSE means the opposite—high error.
explanations.d: Perfect accuracy is unrealistic and would result in MSE = 0.

questions.question: In the equation Y = β0 + β1X + ε, what does the error term (ε) represent?

answers.a: The part of Y explained by X
answers.b: Random variation in Y not captured by the linear model
answers.c: The slope of the regression line

explanations.a: The explained part is β0 + β1X.
explanations.b: Correct! ε represents noise or unexplained variation.
explanations.d: Ŷ is the predicted value, not ε.

questions.question: What does the intercept (β0) represent in a simple linear regression model?

answers.a: The predicted value of Y when X = 0
answers.d: The variability in the dependent variable

explanations.a: Correct! β0 tells us the expected value of Y when X is 0.
explanations.b: β1 is the slope, not β0.
explanations.c: The number of observations is n, not β0.
explanations.d: Variability is measured by variance or standard deviation.

questions.question: Why do we perform Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) before fitting the regression model?

answers.a: To check whether a linear trend exists between study hours and exam scores
answers.b: To automatically calculate the regression coefficients
answers.c: To split the dataset into training and testing sets
answers.d: To remove the need for preprocessing

explanations.a: Correct! EDA helps visually confirm linearity, an important assumption.
explanations.b: Coefficients are calculated during model fitting.

questions.question: What does a high R-squared (R²) value indicate about a regression model?

answers.a: The model explains a large portion of the variation in the data
answers.b: The model has a high error term
answers.d: The training data contains no noise

explanations.a: Correct! High R² means the model explains most of the variability in Y.
explanations.b: High error corresponds to low R².
explanations.c: A horizontal line means no relationship.
explanations.d: Noise can still exist even if R² is high.
